title: Homestuck: The Phenomenon
people: Alexis Hemsley, Sophie McFarland, Cathy Rye, Paul Wright
description:
Let me tell you about Homestuck. What started as a text adventure-style web comic has spawned a world of mythology, fan work, community participation, and even an upcoming game. 

What is it about Homestuck that has resulted in such a huge following? Our experts will tell you all about the comic and the weird and wonderful universe it has spawned.

title: Crucial moments in Classic Dr Who
people: Damian Magee, Heather Magee, David Medlen
description: A look at what moments changed Dr Who and resonated through its’ fifty year history. Elements of the show that worked, why they worked, how do they resonate today.

title: Writing Overtly Feminist Books In A Non Feminist World
tags: Craft of Writing, Needs People, Social Justice
description: Writing often reflects the real world, but sometimes the real world isn't the best place to be. Sometimes, when faced with inequalities in the real world, writers will create books that push against that dominant narrative. How do they do it, and what does it look like?

title: Good Eats: The Geekiest Cooking Show On Earth
people: Bec Handcock, John Parker, Shay Telfer
description: So here's a cooking show like you wouldn't believe. The presenter is a cook, not a chef, so the recipes can actually be made. He brings a science bent to it, so you know WHY you need to do the things the recipe requires, plus a Food Anthropologist assists so you know the history of your food. Finally he brings a geek cred, quoting Monty Python, Indiana Jones and even the Exorcist. That's why this show is gosh darn it, GOOD EATS!

title: The Good Die Young:Short Lived Series
people: Belinda Forbes, Kat Griffiths, David Gunn
description:
There are lots of shows that didn't make it past their first or second season despite good premises for a variety of reasons. This doesn't make them bad shows. Our panellists discuss what died young, why it died young and why you should still watch it.
PLEASE NOTE: "FIREFLY" is not going to be discussed here.

title: Where All the Cool Kids Are: On the Rise of Indie Videogaming
people: Paul Chamberlain, Brendan Ragan, Lisa Rye, Wendy White
description: As the power of BlizElectronic Arctovision rose, more and more great developers squeezed out the sides. At the same time new distribution models appeared (STEAM, the "bundles", Desura and the like) allowed a new model to develop. Add in kickstarter and suddenly Indie Games are the place everyone wants to be be. Come hear about this fascinating phenomenon, including comments by members of local indie development teams.

title: Person of Interest
description: _Person of Interest_, the CBS crime procedural show, has a surprising number of SF fans. What makes this show so popular among SF fandom? Why is it so fun?

title: Wham! Pow! Hug!: Our Favourite Comics
people: Jon Hayward, Krisjan Lie, Candice Schilder
description:
Rather than focussing on the "Latest and Greatest" our panellists talk about what they like across all of their comics reading, from early strips to the modern age.
Each panellists gets a tiny window to spruik their fave. Come along to pick up some great reading tips for comics you may not have previously read.

title: Rise of the Mutants: The X-Men under Chris Claremont
description: Before Chris Claremont came along, the X-Men had been cancelled. They were two dimensional and the villains were worse. A young up-n-coming comic writer was given the opportunity to "try out" on the back of a successful relaunch. Little did the Marvel management realise that within a few years, this unknown title by an unknown writer would allow them to dominate comics for years to come.

title: Genre Themes in Non Genre Shows
description: Castle had a time-travel episode; Bones has dipped into the supernatural; White Collar deals regularly with conspiracies, both real and imagined. It seems that all throughout non-genre shows, genre themes keep popping up. Let's discuss some of our favourites, and why these themes are so appealing.

title: Fangirling About Non-Genre Shows
people: Denai Edwards, Katherine McFarlane, Ruth Turner
description: What gets you hot outside the "central" fandom SF/F TV shows? Got a soft spot for "White Collar"? Like you some "Leverage"? "Dexter" does it for you? "Breaking Bad" is breaking good?

title: Art in Non-Traditional Media
description:
Sky Whales. Giant Floating Ducks. Mechanimae. Spraypainted stencils. Sometimes the best art isn't the stuff hanging in frames in the galleries. We examine, suggest and critique Art outside the usual boundaries.

Moderator: Heather Magee

title: Writers Workshop: Worldbuilding
people: Anne Bishop, Doug Burbidge, Jim Butcher, Satima Flavell, Dave Luckett
description:
Worldbuilding is one of the most crucial parts of writing a believable story. From the cultures of the distant past to the destitution of a post-apocalyptic future, a cleverly crafted world can draw a reader from their own existence and plant them in an entirely new universe. 

Our panel of writers will take you through their process to develop believable and in-depth worlds.

Moderator: Doug Burbidge

title: Maintaining a useful and meaningful web presence 101 for authors
people: Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody, Andrew Harvey
description:
For Authors, a decent online presence is bread and jam!

William Gibson famously left the internet and then came back. How exactly do you balance that fine line between just "Mucking about on the net" and "promoting myself via new media"? We'll also look at how prominent netentities do this...

title: Guilty Pleasures: Movies and TV that we love to watch but hate to admit to
people: Wuffie , Stephen Dedman, Krisjan Lie, Katherine McFarlane, Elaine Walker
description:
Psst. PSST! Hey buddy! Wanna buy some really trashy TV? Buck Rogers in the 25th Century? Yeah I got some. How about some original series Battlestar Galactica? None of that new series. I hear they cut that with Plot and Acting!
Oh. OH! You want the HARD stuff, MOVIES! Shh. Here we go. BARBARELLA! (And I'll even throw in the drinking game for free).

Moderator: Elaine Walker

title: Who Would Live There?: The Reality of Fantasy / SF worlds
people: Bronwyn Cropely, Stephen Dedman, Glenda Larke, Glenda Larke, Dave Luckett
description:
Fantasy / Sci Fi worlds are great from the outside, but would you (Yes, YOU) really want to live there?
Would YOU want to be a Muggle at Hogwarts? A "Companion" with the shelf life of warm milk to an untrustworthy Timelord? A second rate citizen in a world full of talking animals?

Moderator: Bronwyn Cropeley

title: Matriarchies in Fiction and Reality
description: In the Western Patriarchal society, it can be difficult to imagine what a world dominated by women would look like. Our panelists discuss how they wrote female-dominant societies, and also what those societies look like in the real world.

title: Happy Queer SF
people: Jack Bridges, Alexis Hemsley, Kitty Hemsley
description: A showcase of our favourite happy, queer SF, and why we love them. What makes queer SF good, what makes it bad? How can our queer SF be better?

title: Glorification of Misery
people: PRK , Sally Beasley, Jonathan Durnford, Glenda Larke
description:
What is it about violence and bloodshed that draws our interest? Why is it so alluring? We discuss the reasons why misery is so attractive to us as readers, and as writers. We go over the differences between the fantasy and the reality.

Moderator: PRK

title: SCIENCE! The Fantasy vs the Reality
people: Karina Coldrick, Chris Creagh, Bec Handcock, Anna Hepworth
description:
Giant Jacobs Ladders! Sparks! Things in tubes making bubbles! It's great on the big screen but the reality is so different. We talk to some Scientists about what it's REALLY like to do science.
Grant Reviews! Statistical Analysis! Tutorials!

title: Opening Ceremony
people: 2014 Committee , Sally Beasley, Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody

title: Closing Ceremony
people: 2014 Committee , 2015 Committee , Sally Beasley, Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody

title: Safe Spaces
description: A discussion on the rules of Swancon, what it means to create a safe space, and what that space looks like. This will also go over what to do if you are being harassed, or see someone being harassed.

title: Trailer Park
description: David Gunn and his associated present trailers for upcoming films. Let's get excited about the movies of 2014 and beyond!

title: Trailer Park Setup And Con Spruik
description: While the committee are busy setting up for Trailer Park, why don't you tell us all about upcoming events? Got something to spruik? Now's the time!

title: Strange Invocations: 2014 Masquerade
people: Sally Beasley, Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody
description:
Come along to the Swancon 2014 masquerade ball: Strange Invocations!

Food, drinks and merriment will accompany this night of dancing and delight. Wear a fabulous costume and participate in the costume competition, or dress to the nines and spend the night dancing! 

The ball will open at 8:30pm
Masquerade judging will occur between 8:30pm and 9:30pm So come along between 8:30 and 9:30 to show off your costume and be included in the competition. 
The costume parade will begin at 9:15pm

After that we will have a DJ's mixing fabulous tunes to make it a night to remember!

title: Awards Ceremony
people: Sally Beasley, Sally Beasley, Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody

title: Open Tabletop Gaming (inc Intro to board gaming w/ Rob & Leese
Open Tabletop Gaming (Inc Indie Gaming Day)
2014 Debrief
description: What did you think of Swancon 2014? Do you have any ideas for next year? Come share your thoughts with the committee and help us make Swancon the best it can be!

title: Anne Bishop Guest of Honour Q&A
description: Come and listen to the dynamic Anne Bishop as she tells us all about her life, her craft, and how she made it happen.

title: Isobelle Carmody Guest of Honour Speech
Sally Beasley Guest of Honour Speech
description:
Forty years in fandom and where's my L5 Worldcon?
One of Perth's greatest fans talks about her life in fandom.

title: Wizards of Oz: adaptions, sequels & prequels
description:
Why is it popular and where can we go from here? How has each iteration changed the story? Is the original still the “real” story?

Moderator: Damian Magee

title: Point and Praise: Foreign Live Action shows you may have missed
description: What live-action series have YOU missed, simply because they weren't in English? Our expert panel points out some shows from the last few years that you really should catch up with.

title: My Favourite Anime
people: Denai Edwards, Andy Hahn, Jon Hayward
description: There's so much anime in the world that it can be hard figuring out where to start! Come and listen to people who have already done the hard work explain what their favourites are and why.

title: Would you kindly – Tearing through the Bioshock Trilogy
people: Hope Corrigan, Helen Creagh, Andy Hahn, Brendan Ragan
description: Discussing the family roles, gender roles and political allegiances within the bioshock games. Do the games critiques of americanism, exceptionalism and objectivism hit home and if so how?

title: Gender ambiguity in pop-media
people: Jack Bridges, Cathy Cupitt, Alexis Hemsley
description:
In the media, as in real life, people exist in more than just the binary between two sexes. Intersex, genderqueer, androgynous, and otherwise non-binary characters exist in pop-media, although they are woefully underrepresented and misrepresented. Our panelists discuss the ways that non-binary and gender ambiguous characters are portrayed in the media, paying special attention to the times they've gotten it right.

Moderator: Cathy Cupitt

title: Steaming X-Box 4s – Rifting Through Modern Gaming
people: Ari of XXP , Jetha Chan, Hope Corrigan, Brendan Ragan
description: The last year has seen the release of the next generation gaming consoles. It's also seen the necromancy of Virtual Reality and some new players into the console and microconsole space. Come for a brief overview of what's been happening and the traditional reading-of-the-tea-leaves predictions of our panelists. Then laugh at them in a year when they are horribly wrong.

title: Shakespeare Retold – The Good, The Bad, And The Unexpected.
people: Stephen Dedman, Satima Flavell, Andy Hahn, Sarah McFarlane, Ian Nichols
description:
Few Authors generate as many remakes as the "King of Authors" himself, Shakespeare. Some of these remakes will surprise you in their diversity and range.

Moderator: Andy Hahn

title: Teen Wolf: Jumped the Shark or Still Toothy?
people: PRK , Maia Bobrowicz, Cathy Cupitt, Sarah McFarlane
description:
With two and a half seasons under its belt, Teen Wolf takes us back to the awkwardness and deadliness of surviving in an American high school, then throws in were wolves and hunters, just for good measure. 

The panellists will provide an overview of the show, for those unfamiliar with it, then discuss various topics including its similarity with Buffy, the way it inverts some of the Buffy & Supernatural tropes, gender politics, teen angst and the numerous problems with season three. 

Note: this panel will almost certainly contain Teen Wolf spoilers.

title: The Manga Was Better...
people: Alexis Hemsley, Damian Magee, Colin Sharpe
description:
"I like their drawn stuff better than their animated stuff"
With many Anime springing from a pre-existing Manga, as with all adaptions, there are cases where the source material is better than the derivative works. In some cases the Anime diverges radically from the source material. Our panellists look at some prominent examples.

title: Winter Is Still Coming: So here we are, Season 3
people: Belinda Forbes, Matt Holmes, Eva Maria
description:
Blood, Sex, Betrayal and really really awesome opening credits! Is GoT living up to the hype of the books? Do we still follow every episode (duh!)? Is Tyrion the thinking person's sex symbol? Can we take turns punching Joffrey in the face?

Note: This is discussing the TV show, so no spoilers from the books.

*Warning: May contain adult material.*

title: Sex, Violence, And Torture – Unpacking the violent and sexual imagery in visual fantasy
tags: Adult Only, Deeper Themes, Social Justice, Social Justice
people: Jonathan Durnford, Kat Griffiths, Matt Holmes, Sarah Parker
description:
In many fantasy novels, sex, violence, and sexual violence is used as a way to tell a story. What is the difference between sex and violence used to tell a story, and sex and violence used to titillate and shock? We unpack some of the ways this is done in fiction, when it works, and when it doesn't.

*Warning: Will contain adult material.*

Moderator: Sarah Parker

title: Oculus Rift Horror Games
description: Because what better use for VR gear can you think of? Please be aware the convention committee are not responsible for any changes of underwear required due to overly immersive gameplay.

title: How To Piss Off A Publisher
people: Satima Flavell, Andrew Harvey, Dave Luckett, Cat Sparks
description:
Wanna make sure your next novel / short story NEVER gets published? Wanna make an editor actually fling it across the room or bury it in the compost?

We ask some local editors what gets their dander up and what their worst experiences have been.

title: Editing Erotica, Publishing Porn
tags: Adult Only, Craft of Writing, Editing
people: Jack Bridges, Stephen Dedman, Sarah Parker
description:
Not everything out there is safe for work. Some of the best fun can be had writing / editing on the more mature side of the market. Come an hear our panellists talk about writing Mature media.

*Warning: Will contain adult material*

Moderator: Sarah Parker

title: Writing – The Lifestyle
people: Anne Bishop, Isobelle Carmody, Dave Luckett, Tim McDougall, Anthony Panegyres, Cat Sparks
description:
What does the "typical" day look like for a published author? Is it really all about coffee shops and cats? Learn from writers what the pros and cons of being an author are, and how they manage the work-life balance.

Moderator: Tim McDougall

title: It followed me home mum, can I keep it?: Fantastical Pets
description: What will kids play with in fantasy worlds? Cats are cool but rust monsters are cooler (Although harsh on the furnishings). Gryphons are pretty but who cleans the stable? What do you do when the thing in the jar little Sally caught really is a Fairie (Which is gonna be really pissed off when it awakens)

title: The Future Internet – More Than Just Cat Pics
tags: Needs People, Social Media, Teh Internetz
description: As bandwidth increases, and the tools get more powerful, what things will we see the internet used for in the future? How will the improvements in roaming connectivity shape our future? Will the rise of mega-controllers (such as Google) impact the shape much, as well as the increasing regulation from individual governments?

title: Machines can do the Work: How far are we away from home robotic automation?
description:
It's the dream of anyone who has had to clean their own house / dorm / kitchen. A robotic "companion" to clean, dust and put away the dishes. 
Although we now have some robots available on the market (roomba etc) they lack the sophistication most people would like in a "Rosie the Robot".
How far away are these devices? Will they ever do all we expect? Is keeping a truly smart cleaning autonom just another word for "Slavery?"

title: Who's Going To London?: Worldcon in 2014
description: Squeee! Worldcon is in London this year. Are you going? Can we dominate it like we did Worldcon in Melbourne? Come and chat, share stories and suggestions on what you can do to make the adventure more enjoyable.

title: Diseases and Microbiology
description: Organisms becoming resistant to all our known antibiotics are emerging, adapting and spreading. How will we fight these new superbugs? This is the battle to save modern medicine.

title: Conlangs: The Languages of Fictional Worlds
description:
Conlangs (or constructed languages) bring a feeling of reality to our fictional worlds, and for some people, learning a conlang shows their dedication. In this talk, linguist Daniel Midgley looks at the major conlangs on the scene today, describes how they work, and may even help you decide which one is right for you.

Daniel Midgley teaches applied linguistics at Edith Cowan University and the University of Western Australia. He is also the presenter of the language podcast 'Talk the Talk’ with Ben Ainslie on RTRfm 92.1.

title: Dragons and Quantum Foam: Fantasy And Sci-Fi Elements of Dianna Wynne Jones
description: Diana Wynn Jones frequently juxtaposed fantastical and science fiction elements in her books. Karina Coldrick presents her academic essay on this topic.

title: WASFF AGM
people: PRK , Jack Bridges, Doug Burbidge, Dave Cake, Chris Coman, Samara Morgan, Sarah Parker

title: Queer-baiting: Genuine social justice issue or just fan service?
people: Jonathan Durnford, Kat Griffiths, Heather Magee
description:
Recently PR teams for SF/F/H shows have reached out to fandom in order to help raise their profile through winning popular choice awards and creating social networking buzz. However, when fans speak back about problems with the text, such as racism, sexism, or deliberately including queer subtext with no intent to ever have queer representation on the show, showrunners often react poorly, saying fans are over-reacting or worse. 

Do showrunners have a responsibility to listen to fans respectfully once they’ve broken the fourth wall? Do shows have a responsibility to address problems fans raise, and increase respectful queer representation if they harness slash fans to increase buzz? Join us for a discussion in which we consider the ethics and responsibilities on both sides, in a post-fourth-wall world.

Moderator: Heather Magee

title: Dianna Wynne Jones: An Appreciation
people: Shasta Calvo, Kylie Ding, Bec Handcock, Kimberley Larking
description:
Unfortunately passing away in March of 2011, Diana Wynne Jones is an often under-appreciated literary giant.
With over 50 books published, Movie adaptions and a huge fan base that she loved and interacted with, she was often seen as the thinking reader's JK Rowling.

title: I Liked Your Old Battlestar Better Than Your New Battlestar: Comparing the current wave of remakes to the originals
description: _BSG_, _My Little Pony_, _Tomorrow People_... All remade! Are the new versions better? Worse? What did we like from each version?

title: The Tech Of Invisibility
description: In our media, the technology behind cloaking, phasing, and general invisibility is done badly and unbelievably. But this doesn't have to be the case! Let's discuss the ways that it can be made to work in our fiction, maybe even in the real world!

title: The Visual Tropes of Anime
description: In anime, a lot of information can be learned about characters based solely on their appearance. Learn about the various visual tropes here!

title: Real-Life Magic
people: Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Karina Coldrick, Glenda Larke
description: What would it look like if Magic were real? And how would it work? We'll explore the world of magic, and what it might look like in the real world.

title: Blocks of Art: Fandom and Lego
description: There have been some absolutely beautiful sets made in the LEGO universe. We'll go through some of our favourites in a visual appreciation.

title: What My Library Meant To Me
people: Susanne Ackerman, Stephen Dedman, Satima Flavell, Gina Goddard
description:
School libraries have helped shape many a young fan's life. They were our refuge and hiding place, a gateway into the world of books and adventure. We'll appreciate the many ways school libraries, and school librarians, have helped us in our formative years.

Moderator: Susanne Ackerman

title: Dr Who: Series 7, Part 2
people: Michael Cogan, Aaron Creaser, Damian Magee, Heather Magee
description: A review of the second half of Series 7 of the new Doctor Who. From the Bells of Saint John to the 2013 Christmas special The Time of The Doctor

title: Bountiful Beefcake - The Return
description:
That's right, our favourite cheesy panel is back once more! A look at some of our favourite male characters. They are beautiful.

*Warning: Will contain adult material*

title: Moderating The Moderators
people: PRK , Susanne Ackerman, Bronwyn Cropely, Andy Hahn, Kitty Hemsley, Damian Magee, Heather Magee, Tim McDougall, Sarah Parker, Elaine Walker
description: This panel is for moderators to go over the requirements of moderation. This is a closed programming item.

title: The Life And Times of Hayao Miyazki
description: Through a career that has spanned six decades, Miyazaki has attained international acclaim as a maker of anime feature films and, along with Isao Takahata, co-founded Studio Ghibli, a film and animation studio. Come learn more about him!

title: BATMAN Animated: From 1968 To Today
description: This presentation takes look at history of Batman in animated form from clips to illustrate the history.

title: Revisiting The Classics: A Look At Our Favourite Films of the Past
description: A Look at our Favourite Films of the Past- Bring your classic from any genre as we discuss, are these films still classics?

title: Hanna-Barbera Cartoons: How do they stand up today?
description: This first part of a presentation takes look at the early years and the classic cartoons that made studio famous, from the Flintstones to Scooby-Doo.

title: Video Quiz: Year 8
description: The much acclaimed Video Quiz returns for it's eighth year of production. Come along to watch videos, answer questions, have fun, and prove your geekdom.

title: Classic Who Season 5: The Monster Season
people: Aaron Creaser, Damian Magee, Heather Magee, Colin Sharpe
description: We look at Troughton's second season as the Doctor; with stories from Tomb of the Cybermen to Wheel in Space, this is the season where the Ice warriors, the Yeti and the Great Intelligence was introduce.

title: Indie Board Games - Design And Publishing
description:
What are some of the best ways to take a game from an idea through to a playable prototype and play testing?
Once a game is successfully prototyped taking it to the next step for publication and distribution.

title: Burning Man and Blazing Swan
description:
What is Burning Man and Blazing Swan? Footage and photos from my 2013 Burning Man trip.
The 10 Principals and how they govern the festivals and the attendees.
Sneak Peak as to Blazing Swan Inception Setup and progress.

title: Sexuality, Politics and Religion
tags: Deeper Themes, Social Justice, Social Justice
people: Jonathan Durnford, Matt Holmes, Gladys Spume, Elaine Walker
description:
Are you Polytheistic or Poly-sexual? Transhumanist or transgender? Liberal or libertine? Green or Pink? Left or right?
 
The three things that are not meant to be brought up in polite conversation at dinner parties are sex, politics and religion. Why? Because these are the three subjects that are most likely to offend someone. Perhaps "sex" has become a less taboo subject, but in many cases, discussing deviation in "Sexuality" has not.
 
So, why is it that these subjects have become inextricably linked? Is the “culture war” between science and religion a new or old conflict? Is the separation of church and state narrowing? Why are attempts to legalise gay marriage meeting with such strong resistance?
 
So come on down for a healthy and deep discussion of the Holy (or Unholy) Trinity of small-talk’s greatest enemies.

Moderator: Elaine Walker

title: Open Tabletop Gaming (inc King of Tokyo Tournament
Open Tabletop Gaming (inc Formula D Championship)
Open Tabletop Gaming (inc Indi Gaming w/ Anthony Sweet
Open Tabletop Gaming (inc. Introduction to Board Gaming w Tim & Bron)
Open Tabletop Gaming (inc indi gaming RAEZ Games)
Halo 4 Alternative: Racing, Demo Derby, Tank Racing & Super Happy Fun Land
Halo Reach Fire Fight Survival Challenge
Scott Pilgram vs The World Game!
Retro Game: Golden Eye 64 T ornament
Initial D: Extreme Stage Time Trials
From Space Invaders to Mass Effect: Aliens in Video Games
description: Since the very first video game on a transistor computer, to the multi-platform cgi wonders of today, aliens have been a key feature in video games and video game culture. Our panelists will discuss the development of aliens, both in concept and in execution.

title: From Dragonlance to That Movie: D&D spinoffs in other media
description: D&D changed tabletop gaming in ways that still reverberate throughout the platform. It has also spawned countless spinoffs in other genres, such as novels and films. Come and talk about the effects D&D had on the world, some of the best and worst spinoffs, and why that is.

title: Please Explain: Guardians of the Galaxy and Antman
description: Marvel's upcoming films Guardians of the Galaxy and Antman are getting a lot of buzz, but they're not exactly the most well-known titles. Come here for a brief descriptor of what these are, and why you should (or shouldn't) be interested.

title: Shark Watch: Good Shows Gone Bad
people: Krisjan Lie, John Parker, Candice Schilder
description: Even the best TV shows will eventually hit a point where they just don't work. Which shows have "jumped the shark" in the last 12 months? Why did this happen?

title: Professional AUs: Reimagining Stories In Different Settings
people: Kitty Hemsley, Matt Holmes, Krisjan Lie
description:
Throughout the world, popular stories have been told and told again in different settings and on different worlds. _Treasure Island_ was given a space theme in _Treasure Planet_; _Sherlock Holmes_ was pulled into the modern world with _Elemenary_ and _Sherlock_; _Pride And Prejudice_ had new life breathed into it with _The Lizzie Bennet Diaries_; and many more!

What is the appeal to fans and creators of these new stories? Why are they so popular? We discuss our favourite professional "alternate universe" stories and why we love them.

title: She-Roes and Heroines: Our Favourite Kick-Arse Women
tags: Books, Comics, Fandom, Film, Social Justice, TV
people: Sally Beasley, Amanda Bridgeman, Karina Coldrick, Sorsha Roberts
description: Women are interesting! Lets talk about some of our favourite women in fiction and why they are so awesome.

title: Cards Against Humanity
description: Come and play this most diabolical of card games! *Warning: will contain offensive material and adult content.*

title: Geeky Sing-Along
description: Come along and sing-along to your favourite geeky tunes!

title: Queer Women In Speculative Fiction
tags: Books, Comics, Film, Needs People, Social Justice, TV
description: Queer women have a rich and beautiful history within SF. Some of our favourite works will be discussed here, as well as a look to the future. What will it look like? What do we want it to look like?

title: The Worst RPGs Of All Time
description:
Some RPGs are good, some are bad, some are terrible. Then there are the worst RPGs in existence! This panel is about that last category.

Moderator: Andy Hahn

title: Lost In Translation: US Adaptions of UK and Australian Television
people: David Gunn, Matt Holmes, Damian Magee, Sarah McFarlane
description: _Queer As Folk_, _Life On Mars_, _Rake_. UK and Australian TV shows have been adapted by US producers for both good and ill results. We talk about what worked, what didn't, and why.

title: Comic Art Corrections
description:
Comic book art can be beautiful, but it can also be horribly, horribly wrong. From the dreadfully mangled anatomy of Rob Liefeld to the recycled hackery of Greg Land, sometimes comic art is just bad. 

Resident artist Nancy Lorenz talks about some of the worst offenders of comic book art, and discusses how often this contributes to the objectification of women that is still so prevalent in the industry.

title: Magician to Magician's End
people: Chris Coman, Matt Holmes, Matt Lindus
description:
The storm had broken.
Pug danced along the edge of the rocks, his feet finding scant purchase as he made his way among the tide pools.
From the first publication of Raymond E. Feist's "Magician" in 1982, to the stunning conclusion of The Riftwar Cycle with "Magician's End" in 2013, through Midkemia and Kelewan, around the world to Novindus, and into the Dasati and Demon realms, Pug, Tomas and a rich host of characters have kept us amazed and transfixed in wonderment.
Come with us on a journey of Magic and Adventure as we track our favourite characters through the 30 books written in this rich multiverse.

title: The Dagger of Dresnia Book Launch
description: The Dagger of Dresnia, written by local fan Satima Flavell, is due for release in April. Come and help launch the book and celebrate!

title: The Twelfth Planet Press Cocktail Hour
Pre-Awards Filk Presentation
description: Local talent Ann Poore presents some fan-songs in this wonderful concert. Some work from Dave Luckett will be presented.

title: Anne Bishop Reading
description: Anne Bishop will read some of her works for us.

title: The History of WA Fandom
people: Sally Beasley, Damian Magee, Ian Nichols, Ian Nichols
description:
Western Australia has one of the largest, most cohesive fandoms in Australia. It has a rich history and is full of wonderful people. Lets discuss some of the history of our fandom, and why we think it rocks.

Moderator: Damian Magee

title: Creating Believable Magic Systems
people: Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody, Anthony Panegyres
description:
Magic systems are one of the core aspects of fantasy and fantastical writing. A good magic system can cause the reader to suspend disbelief to such an extent that even the bizarre seems believable. 
But how do you craft such a world? Our panelists discuss the dos and don't of crafting magic systems.

title: It's Earth, Jim, But Not As We Know It: Creating Alternate Earths
tags: Alternate Earth, Books, Craft of Writing
description: From alternate history to urban fantasy, different versions of our world have been a staple to the SF industry. But what separates a believable, albeit strange, earth from a different planet entirely? Our panelists discuss the ways in which alternate earths change, remain the same, and how this works for writing.

title: Keeping it Fresh: New Ideas For Old Series
people: Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody, Anthony Panegyres
description: With long running series or multiple series set in the same world, there's a constant tension between keeping each book fresh, whilst giving people the world they're comfortable with. How do different authors or series handle balancing this tension.

title: No pain, no gain
people: Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody
description: Characters develop through experience, sometimes positive, but often not. Some of our favourite characters have been beaten and worse, only to come out stranger. How do authors torture their characters without falling to simple stereotypes?

title: Open Tabletop Gaming (Inc Indi Gaming Berry Panic)
The Fantasy Novels of Enid Blyton
description: Enid Blyton wrote across a range of genres, including fantasy!  This panel considers the Faraway Tree novels, the Wishing Chair novels and the Noddy series.  A presentation followed by a discussion.

title: The Silent City - An Australian Film Noir
people: Anthony Ciccotosto, Sarah Harris, David Partridge, Andreas Piechulik, Jeff Watkins, Marcelle Weber
description:
_The Silent City_ is a local film made by local people. A black-and white _noir_ style film, it is full of intrigue, secrets, and excitement. 

Some of the actors of the film would like to present some clips from the movie, as well as discuss the making-of and field any questions you might have. As an added extra, two free tickets are available for whoever asks the best questions! (As determined by the panelists)

title: The History Of Ghibli - Take 2
description: Japanese animation production house Studio Ghibli is known to many as "The Disney of the East". Come hear all about the early years of Studio Ghibli works and what went into creation the company today

title: Art Show Judging
people: Sally Beasley, Anne Bishop, Jim Butcher, Isobelle Carmody

title: Ugg-Tect Royale
description:
The 3 or 4 teams of paelolithic panelists, lead by their Ugg-Tects, attempt
to build complex structures while limited by minimal vocabularies and
silly gestures. Spiked clubs may also feature.

Using the rules of the party game Ugg Tect, but taken to the next level,
Rob & Leece help the panelists demonstrate just how hard communication
can be. See also: http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/60131/ugg-tect

title: Creative Time - Spaceships, Weapons and Castles
Rainbow Fairies Colouring In (Daisy Meadows Series)
TV Show and Colouring In - Scooby Doo
The Best of MLP + Colouring In
